have arisen, we should take a lesson from physics. The conclusion of design
flows naturally from the data; we should not shrink from it; we should em-
brace it and build on it.
In concluding, it is important to realize that we are not inferring design
from what we do not know, but from what we do know. We are not inferring
design to account for a black box, but to account for an open box. A man
from a primitive culture who sees an automobile might guess that it was
